thread.title: Back to burgers: Carl's Jr. and Hardee's drop bikini-clad ads
thread.title_full: Back to burgers: Carl's Jr. and Hardee's drop bikini-clad ads

author: Associated Press
title: Back to burgers: Carl's Jr. and Hardee's drop bikini-clad ads
text:
1 of 2 The Associated Press 
In this May 25, 2011, file photo, a man walks past a sign for a Carl's Jr. restaurant in San Bruno, Calif. The fast food chain released an advertisement on March 29, 2017, suggesting it intends to ditch its racy advertising in an effort to focus on its food. (AP Photo/Jeff Chiu, File) Courtesy of Hardee's 
Model Nina Agdal is featured in Hardee's latest ad campaign for its new cod sandwich. Back to burgers: Carl's Jr. and Hardee's drop bikini-clad ads Associated Press ( â€¦ ) The Associated Press 
In this May 25, 2011, file photo, a man walks past a sign for a Carl's Jr. restaurant in San Bruno, Calif. The fast food chain released an advertisement on March 29, 2017, suggesting it intends to ditch its racy advertising in an effort to focus on its food. (AP Photo/Jeff Chiu, File) 
Carl's Jr. and Hardee's are ditching the bikinis and getting back to the burgers. 
The chains are famous for advertisements featuring models and celebrities like Paris Hilton, Kate Upton and Emily Ratajkowski munching on burgers while scantily clad. 
A new commercial for the chains shows the imagined Carl Hardee Sr. taking back control of the operation from immature son Carl Hardee Jr. Carl Sr. rips down photos of swimsuit models and puts up framed pictures of hamburgers. The chains are now calling themselves "pioneers of the great American burger." +1 
Model Nina Agdal is featured in Hardee's latest ad campaign for its new cod sandwich. Courtesy of Hardee's
